intro: Trichantha tenensis, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is known for its milky sap, which contains toxic compounds. Trichantha tenensis is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
